name: Metal Music For Posers : A Quiz | Heavy Metal | 20 Questions

questions.text: Maynard James Keenan shares his last name (but no relation) with a guitarist from what band?
questions.explanation:
Corrosion of Conformity.

	Pepper Keenan is one of the two guitarists in C.O.C.

questions.text: 'The dream is true'....what band made the song that contains this line?
questions.explanation:
Iron Maiden.

	That line is from 'Dream of Mirrors' on 'Brave New World'.

questions.text: Which band had an E.P. for a debut?
questions.explanation:
Tool.

	Tool's 'Opiate' was released in 1992 on Volcano Entertainment.

questions.text: For what song did Metallica make their first video?
questions.explanation: 'One'.

questions.text: The Motorhead song 'Crash and Burn' is featured on which album?
questions.explanation:
'We Are Motorhead'.

	'We Are Motorhead' came out in 2000 on CMC International.

questions.text: How many drummers has Rob Zombie worked with in his career?
questions.explanation:
3.

	While Rob was in White Zombie he first had Ivan DePrume on drums and then John Tempesta (who played with Testament on 'Low'). Both Tempesta and Tommy Lee are on 'Hellbilly Deluxe'.

questions.text: What was the last album by Cannibal Corpse to feature Chris Barnes?
questions.explanation:
'The Bleeding'.

	I've heard two different stories about how Chris Barnes was kicked out of the band. Whichever is true, George Fisher from Monstrosity was recruited and first appeared on 'Vile', which was released in 1996.

questions.text: Name the Slayer song on the 'Dracula 2000' soundtrack.
questions.explanation: Bloodline.

questions.text: What B-side appears on the Static-X single 'Push It'?
questions.explanation:
'Down'.

	'Down' was a leftover from the 'Wisconsin Death Trip' recording sessions.

questions.text: What Obituary song has a dance remix?
questions.explanation:
'Boiling Point'.

	Scott Burn's assistant (who called himself Super Brian) liked doing dance remixes of heavy songs. During the production of 'World Demise' he took 'Boiling Point' and remixed it.

questions.text: Who was Fear Factory's first bassist?
questions.explanation:
Andrew Shives.

	Christian Olde Wolbers joined the band around 1993.

questions.text: Who produced all of Pantera's albums with the exception of 'Reinventing the Steel'?
questions.explanation: Terry Date.

questions.text: Whose amplifier did James Hetfield and Lars Ulrich's early band blow out and in essence destroy?
questions.explanation:
Les Claypool.

	James and Lars snuck off with an amp from the band room at their school, blew it out, and returned it (secretly, of course).

questions.text: Which band was a part of the supposed 'Big Four'?
questions.explanation:
Anthrax.

	The 'Big Four' of the eighties consisted of Metallica, Megadeth, Slayer, and Anthrax.

questions.text: What is G.W.A.R. an acronym for?
questions.explanation:
Gay Women Against Racism.

	Oderus Urungus (or the man who assumes his role), saw this in a newspaper in 1986 and thought 'Hmmm..g..w..a.r.. no, it's stupid!'

questions.text: Who's the lead vocalist on the Judas Priest album 'Jugulator'?
questions.explanation:
Tim 'Ripper' Owens.

	Halford was ousted and working on 'Two' with Trent Reznor, Dickenson had his own solo project at the time, and Kevin Dubrow was still with Quiet Riot.

questions.text: Fill in the blank: 'Unwilling to focus on anything but your _____.'
questions.explanation:
surrender.

	That line was from 'Thinking of You' by A Perfect Circle.

questions.text: What band made the song 'Flight of the Skajaquada'?
questions.explanation: Green Jelly.

questions.text: Who played guitar for Ozzy on 'Bark at the Moon'?
questions.explanation: Jake E. Lee

questions.text: BONUS QUESTION: Who plays guitar for Krom?
questions.explanation:
Gabe Hunt.

	Actually, Krom is a Chino based band so if you got that right you made a lucky guess (or know them). Krom rocks and John Lennon's House Party rules!
